CatDescriptText: Miss Mary Celeste Hunter, 813 New Arlington Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 18, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the Federal Government should immediately enforce the Supreme Court's recent decision in 'Little Rock School Case' or permit the recalcitrant states to take their time in obeying?" answer reads: "Really, I don't think that integration should be put off any longer. If the Federal Government keeps putting it off, we will never get equality."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Celeste Hunter wearing coat with brooch on left lapel and dark gloves, holding books and dark handbag, standing in front of light colored stone building
